channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report E-2024120328
item.description:
Report E-2024120328

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: WILSON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 18, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2014 was tipped over by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and terminal yard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Eastern Environmental Management (EEM) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized soda ash and hand tools to remediate the site and containerized all impacted materials in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024120430
item.description:
Report E-2024120430

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: ZEBULON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: Driver was at the loading rack when the customer overfilled the trailer causing a spill of around 20 gals of Petroleum wax from the dome lid of trailer onto the gravel. The Customer is handling cleanup with kitty litter.
